content:
154. Kafatos, F.C., S.A. Mitsialis, H.T. Nguyen, N.
Spoerel, S.G. Tsitilou and G.D. Mazur (1987). Evolution of
Structural Genes and Regulatory Elements for the Insect Chorion.
In: Development as an Evolutionary Process, R. Raff and E.C.
Raff, eds. (Alan R. Liss, New York). 8, 161-178.
155. Delidakis, C. and F.C. Kafatos (1987). Amplification
of a chorion gene cluster in Drosophila is subject to multiple
pig-regulatory elements and to long range position effects. J.
Molec. Biol. 121, 11-26.
156. Louis, C., C. Savakis, F.C. Kafatos (1987). Possibili-
ties for genetic engineering in insects of economic interest.
In: Fruitflies--Proceedings of the Second International
Symposium. (ed. A.P. Economopoulos) Elsevier, Amsterdam. pp.47-
57.
157. Spoerel, N.A. and F.C. Kafatos (1987). Identification
of genomic sequences corresponding to clones. In: Methods
in Enzymology. Guide to Molecular Cloning Techniques. (S.L.
Berger and A.R. Kimmel, eds.). 152, 588-597.
158. Spoerel, N.A. and F.C. Kafatos (1987). Isolation of
full length genes: Walking the chromosome. In: Methods ip
Enzymology. Guide to Molecular Cloning Techniques. (S.L. Berger
and A.R. Kimmel, eds.). 152, 598-603.
159. Mitsialis, S.A., N. Spoerel, M. Leviten and F.C.
Kafatos (1987). A short defined DNA region is sufficient for
developmentally correct expression of moth chorion genes in
Drosophila. Proc. Natl. Acad. Sci., USA. 83, 7987-7991.
160. Kafatos, F.C., N. Spoerel, S.A. Mitsialis, H.T.
Nguyen, C. Romano, J.R. Lingappa, B.D. Mariani, G.C. Rodakis, R.
Lecanidou and S.G. Tsitilou (1987). Developmental control and
evolution in the chorion gene families of insects. In: Advances
ip Genetics. (J.G. Scandalios, ed.) gg, pp.223-242.
161. Romano, C.P., B. Bienz-Tadmor, B.D. Mariani and F.C.
Kafatos (1987). Both early and late Drosophila chorion gene
promoters confer correct temporal, tissue and sex specificity on
a reporter Adh gene. EMBO 1, 783-790.
162. Mariani, B.D., J.R. Lingappa and F.C. Kafatos (1988).
Temporal regulation in development: Negative and positive pip-
regulators dictate the precise timing of expression of a
Drosophila chorion gene. Proc. Natl. Acad. Sci., USA 85, 3029-
3033.
163. Loukas, M. and F.C. Kafatos (1988). Chromosomal
locations of actin genes are conserved between the melanogaster
and obscura groups of Drosophila. Genetica li, 33-41.
15
